title: India's Inshorts raises $60 million following Public social network app growth
summary: Indian news aggregator startup Inshorts has secured $60 million in new funding, driven by the success of its social media app Public launched two years ago. The funding demonstrates investor confidence in the company's expansion into social networking.
content:
Indian startup Inshorts, which began as a news aggregation platform, has successfully raised $60 million in a new financing round. The funding comes as a validation of the company's strategic expansion into social media with its app called Public, launched two years ago.

The startup confirmed the investment, which signals growing investor confidence in Inshorts' ability to diversify beyond its core news aggregation service. The Public app, their social networking venture, has shown promising growth metrics since its launch, contributing to investor interest in the company.

Inshorts has managed to establish itself in the Indian digital media landscape, first through its concise news delivery format, and now through its social networking initiative. The fresh capital is expected to fuel further expansion and development of both platforms.
